page.title: 19PEEL HALL HOSPITAL IN L/H
page.content: In this Psycho-Geriatic Hospital there are 38 patients cared for by 30 nurses and a number of visiting doctors. The patients are old, confused and somewhat demented. Although the hospital is equipped, patients are sometimes sent to Salford Royal or Prestwich if their condition requires special treatment. Patients are encouraged to exercise regularly. Many enjoy a walk along the magnificent hallway, up the impressive staircase and past the remarkable stain glass window. Others walk in the grounds and some venture to the local shopping precinct with the help of the nurses. Men and women are not encouraged to mix except on special occasions such as Christmas or for special birthday parties. There are not many visitors and so the staff have to be exceptionally caring and dedicated.
